bitfield.description: 0 = disconnected. 1-15 = connected to channelID = CHANID.

A value of 0 specifies that the event is not connected

bitfield.description: Enable the power
Clear the RESETSTKY bit in the STAT register
Assert reset to the peripheral
This bit indicates, if the peripheral was reset, since this bit was cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register

bitenum.description: The peripheral has not been reset since this bit was last cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register
The peripheral was reset since the last bit clear

bitfield.description: Selects divide ratio of module clock

register.description: Clock Select for Ultra Low Power peripherals

bitenum.description: Does not select this clock as a source

bitfield.description: Free run control

bitenum.description: The peripheral freezes functionality while the Core Halted input is asserted and resumes when it is deasserted.
The peripheral ignores the state of the Core Halted input

bitfield.description: Soft halt boundary control. This function is only available, if [FREE] is set to 'STOP'

bitenum.description: The peripheral will halt immediately, even if the resultant state will result in corruption if the system is restarted
The peripheral blocks the debug freeze until it has reached a boundary where it can resume without corruption

Major rev of the IP

Module identification contains a unique peripheral identification number. The assignments are maintained in a central database for all of the platform modules to ensure uniqueness.
Counter CCP0
Counter CCP1
Counter CCP0 Disable Mask Defines whether CCP0 of Counter n is forced low or not

bitenum.description: Output function as selected by the OCTL register CCPO field are provided to occpout[0].

bitfield.description: Clock Enable Disables the clock gating to the module. SW has to explicitly program the value to 0 to gate the clock.

Timer Cross trigger enable. This field is used to enable whether the SW or HW logic can generate a timer cross trigger event in the system. These cross triggers are connected to the respective timer trigger in of the other timer IPs in the SOC power domain.
The timer cross trigger is essentially the combined logic of the HW and SW conditions controlling EN bit in the CTRCTL register.
Enable the Input Trigger Conditions to the Timer module as a condition for Cross Triggers. Refer Figure 8 Cross Trigger Generation Path
Used to Select the subscriber port that should be used for input cross trigger. Refer Figure 8 Cross Trigger Generation Path

bitenum.description: Use FSUB0 as cross trigger source.
Use FSUB1 as cross trigger source.
Use Zero event as cross trigger source.
Use Load event as cross trigger source.
Use CCD0 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCD1 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCD2 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCD3 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCU0 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCU1 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCU2 event as cross trigger source.
Use CCU3 event as cross trigger source.

bitfield.description: Generate Cross Trigger This bit when programmed will generate a synchronized trigger condition all the cross trigger enabled Timer instances including current timer instance.
Current Counter value

Counter Enable. This bit allows the timer to advance This bit is automatically cleared if REPEAT=0 (do not automatically reload) and the counter value equals zero. CPU Write: A register write that sets the EN bit, the counter value is set per the CVAE value. Hardware: This bit may also be set as the result of an LCOND or ZCOND condition being met and the counter value changed to the load value or zero value, respectively.

Repeat. The repeat bit controls whether the counter continues to advance following a zero event, or the exiting of a debug or fault condition. If counting down, a zero event is followed by a load at the next advance condition. If counting up-down, a zero event is followed by an advance event (+1). The intent of encoding 3 is that if the debug condition is in effect, the generation of the load pulse is deferred until the debug condition is over. This allows the counter to reach zero before counting is suspended.

bitenum.description: Does not automatically advance following a zero event.
Continues to advance following a zero event.
Continues to advance following a zero event if the debug mode is not in effect, or following the release of the debug mode.

bitfield.description: Count Mode

Counter Value After Enable. This field specifies the initialization condition of the counter when the EN bit is changed from 0 to 1 by a write to the CTRCTL register. Note that an external event can also cause the EN bit to go active.

bitenum.description: The counter is set to the LOAD register value
The counter value is unchanged from its current value which could have been initialized by software
The counter is set to zero

bitfield.description: Debug Resume Behavior This bit specifies what the device does following the release/exit of debug mode.

bitenum.description: Perform the action as specified by the CVAE field.

bitfield.description:
Counter Load Control. This field specifies what controls the counter operation with respect to setting the counter to the LD register value.
Encodings 1-3 are present based on the CCPC parameter value. Bits 4-5 are present based on the HQEI parameter value. Any encodings not provided are documented as reserved.

bitenum.description: CCCTL_2 LCOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
CCCTL_3 LCOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
Controlled by 2 input QEI mode. This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.
Controlled by 3 input QEI mode. This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.

bitfield.description: Counter Advance Control. This field specifies what controls the counter operation with respect to advancing (incrementing or decrementing) the counter value. Encodings 1-3 are present based on the CCPC parameter value. Bits 4-5 are present based on the HQEI parameter value. Any encodings not provided are documented as reserved.

bitenum.description: CCCTL_2 ACOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
CCCTL_3 ACOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
Controlled by 2-input QEI mode This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.
Controlled by 3-input QEI mode This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.

bitfield.description:
Counter Zero Control This field specifies what controls the counter operation with respect to zeroing the counter value.
Encodings 1-3 are present based on the CCPC parameter value. Bits 4-5 are present based on the HQEI parameter value. Any encodings not provided are documented as reserved.

bitenum.description: CCCTL_2 ZCOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
CCCTL_3 ZCOND This value exists when there are 4 channels.
Controlled by 2-input QEI mode This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.
Controlled by 3-input QEI mode This value exists when gptimer support QEI feature.

bitfield.description: Load Value

register.description: Capture or Compare Register 0 to Capture or Compare Register 1

bitfield.description: Capture or compare value
Capture Condition. #br# Specifies the condition that generates a capture pulse. 4h-Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: Rising edge of CCP or trigger assertion edge
Falling edge of CCP or trigger de-assertion edge
Either edge of CCP or trigger change (assertion/de-assertion edge)

bitfield.description: Advance Condition. #br# Specifies the condition that generates an advance pulse. 6h-Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: Rising edge of CCP or trigger assertion edge
Falling edge of CCP or trigger de-assertion edge
Either edge of CCP or trigger change (assertion/de-assertion edge)

bitfield.description: Load Condition. #br# Specifies the condition that generates a load pulse. 4h-Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: Rising edge of CCP or trigger assertion edge
Falling edge of CCP or trigger de-assertion edge
Either edge of CCP or trigger change (assertion/de-assertion edge)

bitfield.description: Zero Condition. #br# This field specifies the condition that generates a zero pulse. 4h-Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: Rising edge of CCP or trigger assertion edge
Falling edge of CCP or trigger de-assertion edge
Either edge of CCP or trigger change (assertion/de-assertion edge)

bitfield.description: Capture or Compare. #br# Specifies whether the corresponding CC register is used as a capture register or a compare register (never both).
Capture and Compare Update Method This field controls how updates to the pipelined capture and compare register are performed (when operating in compare mode, COC=0).

bitenum.description: Writes to the CCx_y register is written to the register directly and has immediate effect.
Following a zero event Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0.
Following a compare (down) event Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals the CCx_y register value.
Following a compare (up) event Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals the CCx_y register value.

Following a zero or load event Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to ECCx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0 or CTR. Equals LD. Note this update mechanism is defined for use only in configurations using up/down counting. This mode is not intended for use in down count configurations.
Following a zero event with repeat count also zero. Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0 and if RC equal 0.
Following a TRIG pulse. Writes to the CCx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCx_y #xD; 0.

bitfield.description: CCACT shadow register Update Method This field controls how updates to the CCCACT shadow register are performed

bitenum.description: Value written to the CCACT register has immediate effect.
Following a zero event Writes to the CCACTx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCACTx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0.
Following a compare (down) event Writes to the CCACTx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCACTx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals the CCx_y register value.
Following a compare (up) event Writes to the CCACTx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCACTx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals the CCx_y register value.

Following a zero or load event Writes to the CCACTx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCACTx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0 or CTR. Equals LDn. Note this update mechanism is defined for use only in configurations using up/down counting. This mode is not intended for use in down count configurations.

Following a zero event with repeat count also zero. Writes to the CCACTx_y register are stored in shadow register and transferred to CCACTx_y in the TIMCLK cycle following CTR equals 0 and if RC equal 0.
On a TRIG pulse, the value stored in CCACTx_y shadow register is loaded into CCACTx_y active register.

bitfield.description: Selects the source second CCU event.
Selects the source second CCD event.
CCP Output Invert The output as selected by CCPO is conditionally inverted.
CCP Initial Value This bit specifies the logical value put on the signal generator state while the counter is disabled (CTRCTL.EN == 0).
CCP Output Source

bitenum.description: Signal generator value (for example, PWM, triggered PWM)
Mirror CCP of first capture and compare register in counter group
Mirror CCP of second capture and compare register in counter group

bitfield.description: CCP Output Action on Zero Specifies what changes occur to CCP output as the result of a zero event.

bitfield.description: CCP Output Action on Load Specifies what changes occur to CCP output as the result of a load event.

bitfield.description:
CCP Output Action on Software Froce Output
This field describes the resulting action of software force.
This action has a shadow register, which will be updated under specific condition. So that this register cannot take into effect immediately.

bitenum.description: This event is disabled and a lower priority event is selected if asserting. The CCP output value is unaffected by the event.
CCP output value is set high
CCP output value is set low

bitfield.description: Input Select (CCP0) This field selects the input source to the filter input. 4h-7h = Reserved

bitenum.description: CCP of the corresponding capture compare unit
Input pair CCPX of the capture compare unit. For CCP0 input pair is CCP1 and for CCP1 input pair is CCP0.
XOR of CCP inputs as input source.

bitfield.description: Input Inversion This bit controls whether the selected input is inverted.
Filter Period. This field specifies the sample period for the input filter. I.e. The input is sampled for FP timer clocks during filtering.

Consecutive Period/Voting Select
This bit controls whether the input filter uses a stricter consecutive period count or majority voting.

bitenum.description: Consecutive Periods The input must be at a specific logic level for the period defined by FP before it is passed to the filter output.

Voting The filter ignores one clock of opposite logic over the filter period. I.e. Over FP samples of the input, up to 1 sample may be of an opposite logic value (glitch) without affecting the output.

bitfield.description: Filter Enable This bit controls whether the input is filtered by the input filter or bypasses to the edge detect.

External Trigger Select. #br# This selects which System Event is used if the input filter selects trigger. Triggers 0-15 are used to connect triggers generated by other timer modules in the same power domain. Refer to the SoC datasheet to get details. Triggers 16 and 17 are connected to event manager subscriber ports. Event lines 18-31 are reserved for future use.

bitenum.description: TRIGx = External trigger input from timer x (if available) in the same power domain as the current timer.

TRIG_SUBx = External trigger input from subscriber port x.
TRIG_SUBx = External trigger input from subscriber port x.

bitfield.description: Trigger Enable. This selects whether a trigger is enabled or not for this counter 0x0 = Triggers are not used 0x1 = Triggers are used as selected by the ETSEL field

bitenum.description: Triggers are used as selected by the IE, ITSEL and ETSEL fields.
